en_lcc_a.long_description: Reference works and general collections from Project Gutenberg's Class A holdings: encyclopedias, dictionaries, collected essays, almanacs, and other General Works

en_lcc_b.long_description: Works on philosophical thought, psychological studies, religious texts, theology, and comparative religion

en_lcc_c.long_description: Historical methodology, chronology, genealogy, heraldry, diplomatics, numismatics, and other specialized tools for historical research.

en_lcc_d.long_description: Historical works covering Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia, New Zealand, and other regions outside the Americas.

en_lcc_e.long_description: Historical works, documents, and narratives covering United States history and historical events in the Americas.

en_lcc_f.long_description: Historical works covering Canada, Latin America, and other regions of the Americas beyond the United States.

en_lcc_g.long_description: Works on world geography, maps, anthropology, ethnology, folklore, sports, games, and recreational activities.

en_lcc_h.long_description: Economics, sociology, statistics, social theory, commerce, communication, transportation, and other social science disciplines.

en_lcc_j.long_description: Political theory, government systems, public administration, international relations, political philosophy, and civic affairs.

en_lcc_k.long_description: Legal texts, jurisprudence, comparative law, international law, and legal systems from various jurisdictions worldwide.

en_lcc_l.long_description: Educational theory, pedagogy, teaching methods, curriculum development, and works on educational systems and institutions.

en_lcc_m.long_description: Musical scores, music theory, music history, biographies of composers, and analytical works on musical composition and performance.

en_lcc_n.long_description: Works on painting, sculpture, drawing, architecture, decorative arts, art history, and artistic techniques and criticism.

en_lcc_p.long_description: General literary works, linguistics, philology, and literature that spans multiple language families and traditions.

en_lcc_q.long_description: Mathematics, astronomy, physics, chemistry, geology, paleontology, biology, botany, zoology, and other natural sciences.

en_lcc_r.long_description: Medical texts, anatomy, physiology, public health, nursing, pharmacology, pathology, and clinical practice across medical specialties.

en_lcc_s.long_description: Farming, horticulture, forestry, animal husbandry, agricultural science, soil management, and rural economic topics.

en_lcc_t.long_description: Engineering, manufacturing, industrial arts, construction, mechanical trades, chemical technology, and applied sciences.

en_lcc_u.long_description: Military history, strategy, tactics, armed forces organization, military engineering, and defense-related topics.

en_lcc_v.long_description: Naval operations, maritime warfare, naval history, seamanship, navigation, and naval architecture and engineering.

en_lcc_z.long_description: Works on bibliography, cataloging, library management, book history, publishing, and information organization systems.

en_lcc_pa.description: Greek and Latin language and literature
en_lcc_pa.long_description: Classical Greek and Latin texts, ancient literature, classical philology, and works from Greco-Roman civilization.

en_lcc_pb.long_description: Celtic languages including Irish, Welsh, Scottish Gaelic, Breton, and modern European languages not covered elsewhere.

en_lcc_pc.long_description: French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Romanian, Catalan language studies, philology, and linguistics of Romance languages.

en_lcc_pd.long_description: German, Dutch, Scandinavian language studies, philology, linguistics, and comparative Germanic language research.

en_lcc_pe.long_description: English language studies, grammar, etymology, dialects, linguistics, philology, and the history of the English language.

en_lcc_pf.long_description: Dutch, Flemish, Afrikaans, Frisian, and other West Germanic languages beyond English and German.

en_lcc_pg.long_description: Russian, Polish, Czech, Serbian, Croatian, Lithuanian, Latvian, Albanian language studies and linguistics.

en_lcc_ph.long_description: Finnish, Hungarian, Estonian, Basque, and other Uralic language family studies and linguistics.

en_lcc_pj.long_description: Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, Ethiopic, and other Semitic and Near Eastern languages and their literatures.

en_lcc_pk.long_description: Sanskrit, Persian, Hindi, Urdu, and other Indo-Iranian languages, plus their classical and modern literatures.

en_lcc_pl.long_description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean, African languages, Pacific Island languages, and their respective literatures.

en_lcc_pm.long_description: Native American languages, constructed languages like Esperanto, and indigenous languages of the Arctic regions.

en_lcc_pn.long_description: General literary criticism, theory, drama, poetry, prose, rhetoric, journalism, and literary history across cultures.

en_lcc_pq.long_description: Literary works and criticism from French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, and other Romance language literary traditions.

en_lcc_pr.long_description: British literature including poetry, drama, fiction, and prose from medieval times through modern periods.

en_lcc_ps.long_description: United States literature including novels, poetry, drama, essays, and literary criticism from American authors.

en_lcc_pt.long_description: German, Dutch, Flemish, Afrikaans, Scandinavian, Old Norse, Icelandic, Danish, Norwegian, Swedish literary works.

en_lcc_pz.long_description: Fiction collections, children's literature, young adult fiction, and literary works for juvenile readers.
